Posted By: Tsuichoi (10/5/2012 9:45:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: That art work is sick. I pulled one of these, somehow not realizing the advantages it can give you. I played around with it though and realized how good this card can help any color deck ramp up a little. I have a blue/white splicer deck, this guy goes in awesome because he gets all the bonuses from [Blade Splicer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blade Splicer), [Master Splicer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Splicer), and [Wing Splicer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wing Splicer). I'm running [Phantasmal Image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantasmal Image) in there as well. The draw back of Phantasmal Image (Having to sac it) is negated by the fact that if it's a copy of Solemn I get to draw a card :)
posts.html:
That art work is sick. I pulled one of these, somehow not realizing the advantages it can give you. I played around with it though and realized how good this card can help any color deck ramp up a little. I have a blue/white splicer deck, this guy goes in awesome because he gets all the bonuses from Blade Splicer, Master Splicer, and Wing Splicer. I'm running Phantasmal Image in there as well. The draw back of Phantasmal Image (Having to sac it) is negated by the fact that if it's a copy of Solemn I get to draw a card :)

posts.post_content:
So am I the only one that gets chills JUST by looking at this card's new artwork? The abilities are great too and I love the throwback, but every time I see my playset I just am in awe at the beauty of it.  
  
5/5  
  
Best part, the whole "Dies to Doom Blade" is a positive for this! You essentially have 4 mana snag you a draw, a land, and what might as well be a discard on your opponent's part, IN ANY COLOR. And that's a pretty sweet deal.
